revised_title: Robert Moray's Observations on Barnacles and their Life Cycle
tldr: In this article, Sir Robert Moray describes his observations of barnacles found on timber in the Western Islands of Scotland. He notes the barnacles' shells, which contain small birds, and discusses their growth and life cycle. Moray also mentions that he has not seen the birds alive and has not examined their internal parts.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
